name: Outreach
description: Two-way Outreach integration for Prospects & Accounts

private_settings.description: On the authentication screen, log into Outreach with your username and password, if you are not already logged in

private_settings.title: OAuth Token Created At in millis since epoch

private_settings.title: Fields to match for User Identity Resolution

private_settings.title: User Attributes to capture from Outreach

private_settings.title: Account Attributes to capture from Outreach

private_settings.name: link_users_in_hull
private_settings.title: Link Users to Accounts in Hull
private_settings.description:
Do you want to let Outreach update links between Users and Accounts in Hull? Be careful about conflicts with other connectors that would link users too.

**IMPORTANT:** when this checkbox is checked the connector will create a Hull Account for EVERY Outreach Account any Prospect is linked to (refer to documentation for more details).

private_settings.name: synchronized_account_segments
private_settings.title: Account Filter
private_settings.description: Send *Accounts* as Accounts to Outreach.io when belonging to one of these segments

private_settings.name: outgoing_account_attributes
private_settings.title: Account Attributes to send to Outreach

private_settings.name: link_users_in_service
private_settings.title: Link Prospects to Accounts in Outreach
private_settings.description: Do you want to let Hull associate Contacts and Companies in Outreach?

confirm.text: You are about to pull all accounts from Outreach into Hull.  Please make sure you've configured your account identity properly, and that you have the attributes you'd like pulled configured.  Be careful when clicking this multiple times, it can result in long operations.  Check out the "Logs" tab to track incoming.account.success messages as accounts are ingested

You are about to pull all users from Outreach into Hull.  Please make sure you've configured your user identity properly, and that you have the attributes you'd like pulled configured.  Be careful when clicking this multiple times, it can result in long operations.  Check out the "Logs" tab to track incoming.user.success messages as users are ingested

json.title: Fetch Historical Events
json.name: fetch_all_events
json.description: Due to Outreach API limitations, this operation won't fetch historical "Prospect Stage Changed" events. If you have whitelisted this event above you will only get new occurrences going forward.

confirm.text: You are about to pull all events from Outreach into Hull.  Please make sure you've configured your user identity properly, and that you have selected the type of events you'd like to pull.  Be careful when clicking this multiple times, it can result in long operations.  Check out the "Logs" tab to track incoming.user.success messages as events are ingested

settings_sections.title: Connect with Outreach
settings_sections.description: Please begin by authenticating this connector with Outreach.  You must have appropriate privileges to grant access.  Hull requests access to only the endpoints which are required to do User and Account synchronization

settings_sections.title: User - Identity
settings_sections.description:
Identity is one of the most important concepts in Hull. The field mapping for user identity should correspond to unique fields across systems. This identity applies to both the data we send to Outreach as well as the data we pull from Outreach. To read more about identity resolution please click [here](https://help.hull.io/hc/en-us/articles/360030051471 "Identity Resolution Explained")

Email is typically a fairly stable identifier, but can be vulnerable to edge cases. Ideally there is an unique identifier (external_id) that can be used across systems. Try to configure the identity before doing anything else. Changes to the identity after the data flow is already setup could result in irreconcilable scenarios.

Please be aware that Outreach rejects user emails with the domain of the customer as well as outreach.io domains.

settings_sections.title: User - Fetching from Outreach
settings_sections.description:
Hull gives its customers the ability to capture a subset of user fields in order to have fine grain control over the dataflow. Please configure the fields that you would like pulled from Outreach below.

Add a mapping by clicking "Map an attribute". To create a new attribute in Hull, you may type in the attribute name in the "Hull Attribute" box on the right and hit enter to create a new attribute.

settings_sections.title: User - Sending to Outreach
settings_sections.description:
Configuring this section will result in automated data flows which will update your users in Outreach. That's why we provide fine grain control over the updates that you send to Outreach. First configure a "Segment" as a user filter to control which users get sent to Outreach. Then configure the attributes you want synchronized. You may always go to a user page and click "Send to" in order to override the filter and send specific users manually.

Please be careful to map similar data types. ie. Not boolean to date

settings_sections.title: Account - Identity
settings_sections.description:
Identity is one of the most important concepts in Hull. The field mapping for account identity should correspond to unique fields across systems. This identity applies to both the data we send to Outreach as well as the data we pull from Outreach. To read more about identity resolution please click [here](https://help.hull.io/hc/en-us/articles/360030051471 "Identity Resolution Explained")

Domain can be a good identifier, but be careful because Hull will use the normalized top level domain to match with other accounts. Ideally there is an unique identifier (external_id) that can be used across systems. Try to configure the identity before doing anything else. Changes to the identity after the data flow is already setup could result in irreconcilable scenarios.

Please be aware that Outreach will reject accounts sent without a name

settings_sections.title: Account - Fetching from Outreach
settings_sections.description:
Hull gives its customers the ability to capture a subset of account fields in order to have fine grain control over the dataflow. Please configure the fields that you would like pulled from Outreach below.

Add a mapping by clicking "Map an attribute". To create a new attribute in Hull, you may type in the attribute name in the "Hull Attribute" box on the right and hit enter to create a new attribute.

settings_sections.title: Account - Sending to Outreach
settings_sections.description:
Configuring this section will result in automated data flows which will update your accounts in Outreach. That's why we provide fine grain control over the updates that you send to Outreach. First configure a "Segment" as an account filter to control which accounts get sent to Outreach. Then configure the attributes you want synchronized. You may always go to an account page and click "Send to" in order to override the filter and send specific accounts manually.

Please be careful to map similar data types. ie. Not boolean to date

settings_sections.title: Events - Fetching from Outreach
settings_sections.description:
This section configures and activates the ongoing fetch of Outreach Events. Start by picking which events you would like to fetch in the dropdown below. Then use the button to optionally fetch some historical events (see further explanation below).
Incoming events are identified by Outreach Prospect ID only, so the best practice is to fetch all Prospects before fetching Events, otherwise empty User profiles without attributes and other identifiers may be created.
